rules.description: Bank holding companies (BHCs) with total consolidated assets of $100 billion or more must submit the Capital Assessment and Stress Testing report.
Intermediate holding companies (IHCs) with total consolidated assets of $100 billion or more must submit the Capital Assessment and Stress Testing report.
Covered SLHCs with total consolidated assets of $100 billion or more must submit the Capital Assessment and Stress Testing report.

For firms subject to Category IV standards, material portfolios are defined as those with asset balances greater than $5 billion or with asset balances greater than ten percent of Tier 1 capital on average for the four quarters preceding the reporting period.
rules.condition: Category IV standards AND (asset balances > $5 billion OR asset balances > 10% of Tier 1 capital)

rules.description: For firms subject to Category I, II, or III standards, material portfolios are defined as those with asset balances greater than $5 billion or asset balances greater than five percent of Tier 1 capital on average for the four quarters preceding the reporting period.
rules.condition: Category I, II, or III standards AND (asset balances > $5 billion OR asset balances > 5% of Tier 1 capital)

rules.description: Only BHCs, IHCs or SLHCs subject to Category I-III standards and that, as of two quarters preceding the reporting quarter, have, on average for four quarters, aggregate trading assets and liabilities of $50 billion or more, or aggregate trading assets and liabilities equal to 10 percent or more of total consolidated assets, must submit Trading and Counterparty schedules.
rules.condition: Category I-III standards AND (average trading assets & liabilities >= $50 billion OR average trading assets & liabilities >= 10% of total consolidated assets)

rules.description: Reporting of all other schedules is subject to materiality thresholds.
Financial reports must be prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
Firms must apply ASU 2016-13 (current expected credit losses methodology) for FR Y-14 reporting purposes in accordance with the effective dates set forth in the ASU.
Reports must be submitted electronically via the Reporting Central submission application.
All schedules are due on or before the end of the submission date, unless that day falls on a weekend or holiday.
New reporters have extended filing deadlines for the first two submissions (90 days after quarter-end) and the third and fourth submissions (65 days after quarter-end).
All schedules must be completed by institutions.  Do not enter information in gray highlighted or shaded cells.
Data collected is subject to confidential treatment under exemption 8 of the Freedom of Information Act and exemption 4.
Firms are not required to report data items if foreign law prohibits it, but must provide a legal analysis.
Amended reports are required if previous submissions contain significant errors or omissions.
Large Institution Supervision Committee-supervised firms must submit an attestation signed by the chief financial officer.
